speaker: Bloggers
vclaim: "Migrants in the Guatemalan Caravan stand on, and then piss on, the flag of the United States before throwing it into the trash."
date: stated on November 2, 2018 in a post on Facebook:
title: The picture of the science stomping is from the 2016 student protest in Wisconsin, not the immigrant convoy.
text: Migrants heading north to the United States-Mexico border did not run police officers and did not treat them harshly. Nor did they burn the American flag or disfigure it with pinned steel. The new allegations that immigrants stand and piss on the flag before they throw it are also false. "Report: Migrants in the Guatemalan Caravan stand, and then pee on, the flag of the United States before being thrown into the garbage can," reads the sealed text over the image of a person standing on a flag that spreads on the ground. The picture was posted on the Bill O'Reily Vance group on Facebook in November. This story was highlighted as part of Facebook ' s efforts to combat false news and misleading information in the broadcast of the news. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) Facebook was published on January 11, 2021 in the Facebook newspaper Nancy Belusi, who was no longer the Speaker of the House of Representatives by Samantha Butterman (January 12, 2021). The picture is not fake, but it is not current. It's still from a news clip of a protest at Wisconsin-Milwake University on 3 April 2016. The activists were protesting Donald Trump, then a presidential candidate who participated in the town hall organized by Fox News. While there was news coverage of people peeing on the side of science - a suspected man in Boston in September and an American activist in 2017 - we were unable to find any reports of such action by immigrants. We're assessing this allegation pants on fire!
